## useContract() function

Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

## Example

```javascript
const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract(
  "{{contract_address}}",
  "nft-drop",
);
```

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function useContract<TContractType extends ContractType>(
  contractAddress: RequiredParam<ContractAddress>,
  _contractType: TContractType,
): UseContractResult<
  TContractType extends PrebuiltContractType
    ? ContractForPrebuiltContractType<TContractType>
    : SmartContract
>;
```

## Parameters

| Parameter       | Type                                                                                           | Description                          |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| contractAddress | [RequiredParam](./react.requiredparam.md)&lt;[ContractAddress](./react.contractaddress.md)&gt; | the address of the deployed contract |
| \_contractType  | TContractType                                                                                  | the type of the contract             |

**Returns:**

[UseContractResult](./react.usecontractresult.md)&lt;TContractType extends PrebuiltContractType ? ContractForPrebuiltContractType&lt;TContractType&gt; : SmartContract&gt;

a response object that includes the contract once it is resolved
